Package lec2_documentation

Class DocumentationExample

  • java.lang.Object
    • lec2_documentation.DocumentationExample
  • public class DocumentationExample
extends java.lang.Object
    The Construction of Graphs that represent a document or a category of documents. Methods for Weighted and Unweighted Graphs included.
    Since:
    12-15-2015

    • Method Detail

      • FromDataTo_UNweightedGraph_old

        public static java.util.HashMap FromDataTo_UNweightedGraph_old​(java.lang.String documentsInput,
                                                               int frame)
        A set of documents or a single document will be represented by an Unweighted Graph. The method provides the assortment of the Edges the Graph involves.
        Parameters:
        documentsInput - A string that includes all the documents from which the representation Graph will be made. The reserved character "N" works as delimiter between paragraphs and documents.
        frame - The frame determines the number of edges will be created to join each Word-Node to the following Words-Nodes. There is no restriction about the size of the frame.
        Returns:
        The edges comprised by the Graph. The data structure of HashMap is used. The key denotes two Nodes that are adjacent in the form Word1_Word2 and the value returns True.

      • FromDataTo_UNweightedGraph

        public static java.util.HashMap FromDataTo_UNweightedGraph​(java.lang.String documentsInput,
                                                           int frame,
                                                           java.util.HashSet filterOutEdges)
        A set of documents or a single document will be represented by an Unweighted Graph. The method provides the assortment of the Edges the Graph involves. It also filters out a set of Edges according to a Feature Selection Method.
        Parameters:
        documentsInput - A string that includes all the documents from which the representation Graph will be made. The reserved character "N" works as delimiter between paragraphs and documents.
        frame - The frame determines the number of edges will be created to join each Word-Node to the following Words-Nodes. There is no restriction about the size of the frame.
        filterOutEdges - The Edges which will be filtered out and will not be included in the Word Graph.
        Returns:
        The edges comprised by the Graph. The data structure of HashMap is used. The key denotes two Nodes that are adjacent in the form Word1_Word2 and the value returns True.

      • FromDataTo_WeightedGraph

        public static java.util.HashMap FromDataTo_WeightedGraph​(java.lang.String documentsInput,
                                                         int frame)
        A set of documents or a single document will be represented by a Weighted Graph. The method provides the assortment of the Edges and Weights that the Graph involves.
        Parameters:
        documentsInput - A string that includes all the documents from which the representation Graph will be made. The reserved character "N" works as delimiter between paragraphs and documents.
        frame - The frame determines the number of edges will be created to join each Word-Node to the following Words-Nodes.
        Returns:
        The edges comprised by the Graph with their corresponding weights. The data structure of HashMap is used. The key denotes two Nodes that are adjacent in the form Word1_Word2 and the value is returned the Weight of the aforementioned Edge.

      • FromAllDocumentsTo_One_UNweightedGraph

        public static void FromAllDocumentsTo_One_UNweightedGraph​(java.util.ArrayList documents,
                                                          int frame)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        documents - All the Documents of the Corpus from which the Word Graph will be constructed.
        frame - The Number "N" of the edges will be created having as Source Node each Word and as Terminal Nodes the "N" following Words.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • FromDataTo_UNweightedGraph

        public static java.util.HashMap FromDataTo_UNweightedGraph​(java.lang.String documentsInput,
                                                           int frame)
        A set of documents or a single document will be represented by an Unweighted Graph. The method provides the assortment of the Edges the Graph involves.
        Parameters:
        documentsInput - A string that includes all the documents from which the representation Graph will be made. The reserved character "N" works as delimiter between paragraphs and documents.
        frame - The frame determines the number of edges will be created to join each Word-Node to the following Words-Nodes. There is no restriction about the size of the frame.
        Returns:
        The edges comprised by the Graph. The data structure of HashMap is used. The key denotes two Nodes that are adjacent in the form Word1_Word2 and the value returns True.

      • removeBlankEdges

        public static java.util.HashMap removeBlankEdges​(java.util.HashMap graph)
        The edges that contain spaces " " are discarded.
        Parameters:
        graph - The N-Gram Graph that it may contain edges with spaces " ".
        Returns:
        The input Graph discarded the edges that contain spaces " ".

      • FromDataTo_NodeDegrees

        public static java.util.HashMap FromDataTo_NodeDegrees​(java.lang.String documentsInput,
                                                       int frame)
        A set of documents or a single document will be represented by an Unweighted Graph. The method provides the assortment of the Nodes and their corresponding Node Degrees the Graph involves.
        Parameters:
        documentsInput - A string that includes all the documents from which the representation Graph will be made. The reserved character "N" works as delimiter between paragraphs and documents.
        frame - The frame determines the number of edges will be created to join each Word-Node to the following Words-Nodes. There is no restriction about the size of the frame.
        Returns:
        The Nodes comprised by the Graph with their corresponding NodeDegrees . The data structure of HashMap is used. The key denotes two Nodes that are adjacent in the form Word1_Word2 and the value returns True.

      • FromDataTo_CommonEdges_NodeDegrees

        public static java.util.HashMap[] FromDataTo_CommonEdges_NodeDegrees​(java.lang.String documentsInput,
                                                                     int frame)
        A set of documents or a single document will be represented by an Unweighted Graph. The method provides the assortment of Edges and Nodes. The method also provide the Node Degrees of the corresponding Nodes.
        Parameters:
        documentsInput - A string that includes all the documents from which the representation Graph will be made. The reserved character "N" works as delimiter between paragraphs and documents.
        frame - The frame determines the number of edges will be created to join each Word-Node to the following Words-Nodes. There is no restriction about the size of the frame.
        Returns:
        an Array of two cells. The 0 cell is the HashMap of the Edges. The cell 1 is the HashMap of the Nodes with their corresponding Node Degrees.
